results.creator_credit: Formula One Films and John Mills
results.brief_description: Looks at the design of a new image and packaging concept for a range of toilet products soon to be marketed. Shows the range of Letraset materials and their application.

results.title: Partners in curriculum
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch and Diane O'Connor
results.brief_description: A program which encourages the participation of teachers, students, parents and school based groups and committees in the planning and development of school curriculum. Examples of how this is happening at Mt. Clear High School, Tallangatta High School and Williamstown High School are shown. Curriculum support services are also briefly mentioned.

results.title: Partners
results.brief_description: A look at people who want to be their own bosses and who look for ways to create their own jobs. Shows students how, with imagination and some risk, a person can carve out a job that does not already exist.

results.title: Participation for all (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Burbank Audio Visual and Ian Andrews
results.brief_description: Describes an elementary school program for all grade levels, how to develop student leadership, and ways of modifying a variety of indoor and outdoor activities to maximise the use of all available space and equipment.

results.title: Participation and equity program
results.brief_description: Outlines the philosophy behind the Participation and Equity Program and provides an overview of the ways in which some schools throughout Australia are implementing programs that are attempting to come to terms with overcoming barriers to effective participation by students in education. Changes in curriculum, school research community groups, and the teaching of English as a second language are just some of the methods outlined. No other credits.

results.title: Partenaires = Partners
results.brief_description:
Marion is a famous actress of the popular theatre who owes her success to her husband, Gabriel, a bitter and alcoholic has-been. This unbalance in their respective fortune is driving their relationship to an end. Everynight, in the changing rooms of the theatre, the two actors engage in a cruel verbal and emotional ‘duel’.

Credits: Producer, Henry Lange ; director, Claude d’Anna ; writers, Laure Bonin, Claude d’Anna ; photography, Pierre Dupouey ; music, Richard Henberger, Egisto Macchi.
Cast: Nicole Garcia, Jean-Pierre Marielle, Michel Galabru, Michel Duchaussoy, Elisa Servier, Jenny Cleves.

results.title: Parrots: look who's talking
results.brief_description: Parrots are exotic, and colourful with amazing character and ability. Birds like the Macaws with their stunning plumage in brilliant blues, reds, greens and yellows, are like living jewels, yet in the wild they become invisible. Cockatoos en masse cause unimaginable destruction to crops. Parrots can be trained to learn tricks, to talk and are incredibly loyal and affectionate pets. This wonderful natural history documentary focuses on parrots in their variety and will astound and amaze.

results.title: Parlor, Bedroom and Bath
results.brief_description: parlor, Bedroom and Bath, stars Buster Keaton in one of his rare talkies, a masterpiece of comedy in which our disaster prone hero is mistaken for a rich playboy and becomes romantically involved with two high society sisters. Largely filmed in Keaton’s own home, “Parlor, Bedroom and Bath” typically depicts Keaton’s knack of portraying the wacky side of life.
